document.heading: District of Columbia Unemployment Compensation Act Amendments of 1978

history.narrative: Law 2-129, the “District of Columbia Unemployment Compensation Act Amendments of 1978,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 2-209, which was referred to the Committee on Employment and Economic Development. The Bill was adopted on first, amended first, second amended first, and second readings on April 18, 1978, June 27, 1978, July 11, 1978, and July 25, 1978, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on August 30, 1978, it was assigned Act No. 2-267 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
